alert.note: Alert for Bleckley; Pulaski (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 27 at 12:59PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Pulaski and southwestern Bleckley Counties through 130 PM EDT... At 1259 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Magnolia to Browndale to near Pinehurst, and moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Cochran, Hawkinsville, Browndale, Mobley Crossing, Mock Springs, Baileys Park, Wallace, Ocmulgee Public Fishing Area, Paulk, Hartford, Pulaski State Prison, Porter and Empire. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for central Georgia.
